pageContext.claim: “So one of them New Yorkers saying well, we're going to change the system a little bit. It's a little late for doing that, isn't it? New York wants to change their [voting] system. They're going to work on something. Governor Cuomo, he's going to work on something now. Well, that ballots are flowing, you know it's a little late.”
pageContext.analysis: Cuomo did make a change to New York’s voting practices on Sept. 26, but it did not have to do with the ballots. Cuomo’s legislation “expedited party enrollment changes to make it easier for voters to participate in the upcoming primary elections.”
